quotes.message: Christmas waves a magic wand over this world, and behold, everything is softer and more beautiful.
quotes.name: Norman Vincent Peale

quotes.message: Christmas is the season for kindling the fire of hospitality in the hall, the genial flame of charity in the heart.
quotes.name: Washington Irving

quotes.message: When we were children we were grateful to those who filled our stockings at Christmas time. Why are we not grateful to God for filling our stockings with legs?
quotes.name: G K Chesterton

quotes.message: Roses are reddish Violets are bluish If it weren't for Christmas We'd all be Jewish.
quotes.name: Benny Hill

quotes.message: Nothing's as mean as giving a little child something useful for Christmas.
quotes.name: Kin Hubbard

quotes.message: Christmas is not a time nor a season, but a state of mind. To cherish peace and goodwill, to be plenteous in mercy, is to have the real spirit of Christmas.
quotes.name: Calvin Coolidge

quotes.message: A good conscience is a continual Christmas.
quotes.name: Benjamin Franklin

quotes.message: Christmas is a season for kindling the fire for hospitality in the hall, the genial flame of charity in the heart.
quotes.name: Washington Irving

quotes.message: Christmas is a time when kids tell Santa what they want and adults pay for it. Deficits are when adults tell the government what they want - and their kids pay for it.
quotes.name: Richard Lamm

quotes.message: Mail your packages early so the post office can lose them in time for Christmas.
quotes.name: Johnny Carson

quotes.message: Next to a circus there ain't nothing that packs up and tears out faster than the Christmas spirit.
quotes.name: Kin Hubbard

quotes.message: Unless we make Christmas an occasion to share our blessings, all the snow in Alaska won't make it 'white'.
quotes.name: Bing Crosby

quotes.message: What I don't like about office Christmas parties is looking for a job the next day.
quotes.name: Phyllis Diller
